verses.verse: An unfriendly<WH6504> man pursues<WH1245> selfishness,<WH8378> and defies<WH1566> all sound judgment.<WH8454>
A fool<WH3684> has no delight<WH2654> in understanding,<WH8394> but only in revealing<WH1540> his own opinion.<WH3820>
When wickedness<WH7563> comes,<WH935> contempt<WH937> also comes,<WH935> and with shame<WH2781> comes disgrace.<WH2781>
The words<WH1697> of a man<WH376>'s mouth<WH6310> are like deep<WH6013> waters.<WH4325> The fountain<WH4726> of wisdom<WH2451> is like a flowing<WH5042> brook.<WH5158>
To be partial<WH5375> to the faces<WH6440> of the wicked<WH7563> is not good,<WH2896> nor to deprive<WH5186> the innocent<WH6662> of justice.<WH4941>
A fool<WH3684>'s lips<WH8193> come<WH935> into strife,<WH7379> and his mouth<WH6310> invites<WH7121> beatings.<WH4112>
A fool<WH3684>'s mouth<WH6310> is his destruction,<WH4288> and his lips<WH8193> are a snare<WH4170> to his soul.<WH5315>
The words<WH1697> of a gossip<WH5372> are like dainty morsels:<WH3859> they go down<WH3381> into a person<WH990>'s innermost parts.<WH2315>
One who is slack<WH7503> in his work<WH4399> is brother<WH251> to him who is a master<WH1167> of destruction.<WH7843>
The name<WH8034> of Yahweh<WH3068> is a strong<WH5797> tower:<WH4026> the righteous<WH6662> run<WH7323> to him,<WH7682> and are safe.
The rich man<WH6223>'s wealth<WH1952> is his strong<WH5797> city,<WH7151> like an unscalable<WH7682> wall<WH2346> in his own imagination.<WH4906>
Before<WH6440> destruction<WH7667> the heart<WH3820> of man<WH376> is proud,<WH1361> but before<WH6440> honor<WH3519> is humility.<WH6038>
He who gives<WH1697> answer<WH7725> before he hears,<WH8085> that is folly<WH200> and shame to him.<WH3639>
A man<WH376>'s spirit<WH7307> will sustain<WH3557> him in sickness,<WH4245> but a crushed<WH5218> spirit,<WH7307> who can bear?<WH5375>
The heart<WH3820> of the discerning<WH995> gets<WH7069> knowledge.<WH1847> The ear<WH241> of the wise<WH2450> seeks<WH1245> knowledge.<WH1847>
A man<WH120>'s gift<WH4976> makes room<WH7337> for him,<WH5148> and brings him before<WH6440> great men.<WH1419>
He who pleads his cause<WH7379> first<WH7223> seems right;<WH6662> until another<WH7453> comes<WH935> and questions him.<WH2713>
The lot<WH1486> settles<WH7673> disputes,<WH4079> and keeps strong<WH6099> ones apart.<WH6504>
A brother<WH251> offended<WH6586> is more difficult than a fortified<WH5797> city;<WH7151> and disputes<WH4079> are like the bars<WH1280> of a castle.<WH759>
A man<WH376>'s stomach<WH990> is filled<WH7646> with the fruit<WH6529> of his mouth.<WH6310> With the harvest<WH8393> of his lips<WH6310> he is satisfied.<WH7646>
Death<WH4194> and life<WH2416> are in the power<WH3027> of the tongue;<WH3956> those who love<WH157> it will eat<WH398> its fruit.<WH6529>
Whoever finds<WH4672> a wife<WH802> finds<WH4672> a good<WH2896> thing,<WH6329> and obtains favor<WH7522> of Yahweh.<WH3068>
The poor<WH7326> plead<WH1696> for mercy,<WH8469> but the rich<WH6223> answer<WH6030> harshly.<WH5794>
A man<WH376> of many companions<WH7453> may be ruined,<WH7489> but there is<WH3426> a friend<WH157> who sticks closer<WH1695> than a brother.<WH251>
